Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "NuGet Job, don't rethrow exceptions if blob is not found" (#10188) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/5628
Context is [here on teams](https://teams.microsoft.com/l/message/19:d10cd9192de2492986fba3baeea3093c@thread.skype/1726693433772?tenantId=72f988bf-86f1-41af-91ab-2d7cd011db47&groupId=ad34ac55-6785-4e7c-82c3-7ba405d30c3c&parentMessageId=1726693433772&teamName=NuGet&channelName=Server&createdTime=1726693433772).
Deployment: [1550336](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_releaseProgress?_a=release-pipeline-progress&releaseId=1550336)

Previously there was many exceptions for NuGet.Jobs `Catalog2Icon`, after deployment it's no more.
**Before:** ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/06871a7a-0c43-44af-a174-cda2d77a28d0)

**After:** 
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0ba7527b-2d74-4860-9910-3b112a8cca96)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Targeting netstandard 2.1 for more projects" (#10190) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Internal projects targeting .net depend on those packages and produce build warnings because of unsupported targets. Nothing really prevents those from targeting netstandard 2.1 (not netstandard2.0 because of [EF](https://www.nuget.org/packages/EntityFramework#supportedframeworks-body-tab)).

Had to apply a fix to Validation DB's `EntitiesConfiguration` similar to what we have for Gallery DB:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/febd3fb35bbf25b4a4d40f56859693e0bbf5d6f0/src/NuGetGallery.Core/Entities/EntitiesConfiguration.cs#L7-L43

Functionally, there are no changes for projects consuming those that target net472 and projects targeting .net can actually now use those.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "PM UI will be closed automatically when clicking the “Migrate packages.config to PackageReference…”" (#6854) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet Version: Release-4.7.0-RTM 5122
VS Version: D15.7 27619.00
OS Version: RS4_Release 17134.1.180410-1804
## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem
1.	Create a C# Class Library (.NET Framework) template via VS.
2.	Open PM UI of the project by right-clicking the project->Manage NuGet Packages… in Solution Explorer.
3.	Install a package with “Packages.config” format.
4.	Right-Click the “References” node and select the “Migrate packages.config to PackageReference…”
## Expected
The PM UI should not be closed automatically.
## Actual
The PM UI will be closed automatically as below screenshot.
![pmuiclosedautomatically](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/39043326-aec4cc56-447c-11e8-97ca-076a85026325.png)
## Note
1. The PM UI for solution will not be closed after clicking “Manage NuGet Packages for Solution…” on solution node in step2.
2. It also repro on the first project with multiple projects in one solution (not repro for other project except for the first one).
![onlyfirstpmuiclosed](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/39043351-b9e7f856-447c-11e8-8864-aa7a400884b5.png)
3. It repro on D15.7 27619.00 (default NuGet Client 4.7.0.5104).
4. It repro on D15.8stg 27618.3003+NuGet Client Dev 5121.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Behavior Change] Raise a missing README warning to <NuGetRequireReadMe> is true" (#13765) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Affected

NuGet SDK

### Current Behavior

When packing a NuGet project, we warn if a README is missing.

### Desired Behavior

When packing a NuGet project and a project specifies <NuGetRequireReadMe>, we should upgrade to an error if a README is missing.

### Additional Context

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/errors-and-warnings/nu5039

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "PMC said ‘No packages installed’ with command ‘Get-Package Updates’ even after several packages are installed" (#3473) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
**Repro Steps:**
1.  Click File -> New project -> Visual C# -> Web -> ASP.NET Web Application, then uncheck the box for "Application Insights".
2.  Click Web Forms template and check “Web Forms” and “Web API”.
3.  Change Authentication to “No Authentication” and click OK button.
4.  Open ‘Package Manager Console’ and ‘Manage NuGet Packages…’.
5.  Click ‘Installed’ tab in PM UI and type command **‘Get-Package Updates’** in PMC.

**Expected Result:**
PMC would say the command is invalid, and the correct command should be 'Get-Package -Updates’.

**Actual Result:**
PMC said ‘No packages installed’, actually you can see in PM UI that there are several packages installed as below screenshot. So the information is wrong.
![nopackageinstalled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20632625/18661988/d4fb55b4-7f4a-11e6-9d70-00da3735560e.png)
**Note:**
1.  It was found on Dev14U3 + MicroUpdate3.5 (With NuGet 3.4.4.1321 in VS).
2.  It doesn’t repro on Dev14 U3 + MicroUpdate3.5 + NuGet 3.5.0-RTM-1846.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The ‘Installed’ drop down in solution PM UI show incorrectly with multiple projects contained" (#4733) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
**NuGet Version:** NuGet 4.3.0-Beta1-2335
**VS Version:** D15Rel 26228.00
**OS Version:** Windows 10 RS1_Release 14393.949.170224-1924

**Repro Steps:**
1. Create a solution with two C# Console Applications via VS.
2. Open the **‘Manage NuGet Package for Solution…’**.
3. Click ‘Browse’ tab and select package ‘Newtonsoft.Json’.
4. Check project1 in the right pane and click install button.
5. **Uncheck** project1 and **check** project2. 

**Expected Result:**
The ‘Installed’ drop down for project2 should show: not installed as below.
![correct](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20632625/23501296/519a6a4e-ff6e-11e6-82b3-424587c36011.png)

**Actual Result:**
The ‘Installed’ drop down for project2 show the version which had just been installed into project1 as below. That doesn't make sense since I have not installed any package into project2 yet.
![incorrect](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20632625/23501372/95638e2c-ff6e-11e6-96c8-55b01a15521e.png)

**Note:**
1. It also repro on Dev14 U3 25431.01 (NuGet Client 3.4.4.1321).
2. It also repro on Dev14 U3 25431.01 + NuGet Client 3.5.0-rtm-1938.
3. It repro on D15Rel 26228.00 + NuGet Client 4.1.0-rtm-2336.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "New restore algorithm reports downgrades for dependencies with missing package versions. " (#13799) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The NuGetGallery repo builds successfully with SDK 8.0.3. However, with .NET 9 RC1, I get NU1605 errors as such:
 
Warning As Error: Detected package downgrade: Microsoft.AspNet.WebPages.Data from 0.0.0 to 3.2.3. Reference the package directly from the project to select a different version.
DatabaseMigrationTools -> NuGetGallery -> Microsoft.AspNet.WebPages.WebData 3.2.3 -> Microsoft.AspNet.WebPages.Data
DatabaseMigrationTools -> NuGetGallery -> Microsoft.AspNet.WebPages.Data (>= 3.2.3)
 
The repo is using CPM and defining the version of Microsoft.AspNet.WebPages.Data as 3.2.3. The package Microsoft.AspNet.WebPages.WebData has a direct dependency on Microsoft.AspNet.WebPages.Data with version 0.0 (any).

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Project argument should be optional to `nuget why`" (#13782) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Affected

dotnet.exe

### Current Behavior

When running `nuget why` I always need to specify a project file.  Other `dotnet` commands like `build`, `restore`, `clean`, `publish` do not require this.

### Desired Behavior

Use the same heuristic for locating a project or solution file when running `nuget why` and one is not specified.

### Additional Context

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue ""Value cannot be null; Parameter name: source" displays in error list when clicking installed tab in PM UI" (#13801) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "Show transitive origin info for packages that are both top-level and transitive in the Solution PM UI" (#13798) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Update the tooltip creation code so a package that is both top-level and transitive shows the transitive origin details in the Solution-level PM UI.

In the Project-level PM UI, we will only show the description for top-level packages, and the transitive origins details for transitive packages, as before.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Scream Test Impacting Alpine Linux Customers on 08/20/2024" (#73) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
On **August 20, 2024**, NuGet.org will conduct a **scream test** that may affect **Alpine Linux** customers. The test is scheduled to begin at **EDT 01:00 PM** and is expected to last between **24 to 72 hours**. We will adjust the test duration based on customer feedback.

During the scream test, **Alpine Linux** customers may encounter **DNS failures** from the [V3 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) due to this [issue](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9736). To mitigate, we recommend that Alpine Linux customers migrate to **Alpine Linux 3.18.0** or a newer version. These newer versions support **TCP fallback** in the DNS resolver.

To ensure uninterrupted service during the test, please use the [V2 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) instead.

If you have any **feedback**, **concerns**, or **questions**, feel free to reach out to us at support@nuget.org or by commenting on the discussion issue: [NuGet/Home#12985](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/discussions/12985).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Scream Test Impacting Alpine Linux Customers on 08/20/2024" (#73) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
On **August 20, 2024**, NuGet.org will conduct a **scream test** that may affect **Alpine Linux** customers. The test is scheduled to begin at **EDT 01:00 PM** and is expected to last between **24 to 72 hours**. We will adjust the test duration based on customer feedback.

During the scream test, **Alpine Linux** customers may encounter **DNS failures** from the [V3 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) due to this [issue](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9736). To mitigate, we recommend that Alpine Linux customers migrate to **Alpine Linux 3.18.0** or a newer version. These newer versions support **TCP fallback** in the DNS resolver.

To ensure uninterrupted service during the test, please use the [V2 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) instead.

If you have any **feedback**, **concerns**, or **questions**, feel free to reach out to us at support@nuget.org or by commenting on the discussion issue: [NuGet/Home#12985](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/discussions/12985).
